The newcomer is leading at the half-way mark!
Is Hovis in the lead of the half-way buoy.
Trent is in the lead of the half-way buoy.
Final stretch. Hovis is in the lead.
Trent leads. Is the countdown of the final stretch.
Hovis has the lead. We're on the final stretch.
We've behave an upset. Trent has the lead. We're on the final stretch.
No doubt! That's the way to go!
I think the newcomer has a chance!
This is why I come here. There's always a surprise in the cards!
You won't even earn pocket change! Aren't you the one!
Five thousand credits on that guy Trent!
Have you seen the odds? Is thirty to one!
Hovis will make short work of him! May he rest in peace.
Go, Hovis! I've got big money on you!
Hovis! What are you DOING?! Don't mess with your reputation!
Let's go Hovis! It's your race!
Hovis, you loser! You cost me a ton of money!
A bottle of your best! Heck, get a round for the guys!
This is too easy for him. He wasn't even close!
You're betting on the newcomer? Three thousand on Hovis!
There's nothing to watch here! Who's up next?
Hovis! You gotta turn it up!
My money is on the newcomer! Three thousand!
Easy money, I smell some easy money!
Ha! This kid has some skills. I like it. I like it!
It's the final stretch! Hovis! Hovis!
Hovis! What the hell was that?!
Not a bad show at all. I feel for you. I really do.
I'm tired of Hovis winning. Can't anybody beat him?!
Ha, ha! Kiss your credits goodbye. Hovis hasn't lost in over a year.
That new guy won't even make it to the first ring!
That's my man! Bring it home, baby!
It's now or never, newcomer! Keep your eyes on the next gate!
Now we're talking! This race is yours, Bretonian!
The newbie wins! I can't believe it!
I won! Look at all them their credits!
Perez and Wallace, protect Quintaine. Mr Trent, let's take down the gunship.
We got one of their fighters.
That was close! Let's get out of here. Mr Trent, take the lead.
I think we're in luck. The intermittent jump-hole to Leeds is phase-aligned right now. We should be able to take it safely. I'm uploading the coordinates. Mr Trent, you take point.
Great. Let's get out of here.
Trent, where are you going? We have to get out of here before they get us cornered.
Quintaine, let's lose this jerk. He's got a death wish.
We'll be at Planet Leeds before you know it, Professor.
Mr Trent, you have the coordinates to Leeds. Take point.
Wallace is down! It's looking grim!
Target the nearest fighter. We can win this one. We have to.
There's the jump-hole... Damn! Enemy ships jumping in, they've seen us!
That's one down. Don't let them near Quintaine!
Quintaine ship can't take much more damage! Cover the transport!
This is Doctor Quintaine. He's a professor.
Uh-huh. And let me tell you he's a tough old bird. He nearly pushed me out of an airlock.

Dynamic.Part: Look, I hate to rush this reunion along...

Subtitles.Static: Now I want you to get clear of this place for a while.

Dynamic.Part: Just until this blows over! I'll be back when I can.

Subtitles.Static: Take care of yourself, old man.

Dynamic.Part: I'm not ready to go.
I do.

Subtitles.Static: Wonderful doing business with you. Good night.

Dynamic.Part: Oh, I'm sure you are.

Subtitles.Static: [laughs] Come on, Mr Wizard. I expect you've come to see the missus.
Someone's here. I'll take care of it.
Hello, my friends. What is it I can get for you today?
Ooh. Nice looking chap. Sorry, haven't seen him.

Dynamic.Part: Listen to me. You are not in Rheinland now, you're in my shop.
I already told you the man you're looking for isn't here, so unless you'd like an education in foreign policy
that you won't soon forget, I suggest you move along. Now!

Subtitles.Static: No, I'm sure you won't be.

Dynamic.Part: She's right. Now that they've got your scent, it's not safe here any more.
I'm not gonna be...
Trent, you can't stay here.

Subtitles.Static: I'll have you know, sir, I am the foremost authority on Xeno-Archeology.
I had to go away, Kendra.
Not long after you made your discovery, things... began to happen.
People around me started to go missing, then I came back one night to find my lab turned upside down and...
I noticed I was being followed.
A man named Kress. He told me I was on a list, that my work had put me in great jeopardy.
I left that night and didn't look back. So you see, I couldn't tell anyone...

Dynamic.Part: especially you! I thought you'd become a target as well.

Subtitles.Static: The night he came, he offered me a place to hide in the Border Worlds. Maybe now is a good time to take him up on it.
I'd rather take my chances with him than those Rheinland agents.
The hell we're not. It's suicide to stay.
Damn it! I am mad as hell at you. What happened? Where have you been?
Yes, it is. But it's obviously part of something more significant.

Dynamic.Part: It's time you and I worked out what that is.

Subtitles.Static: Hm! It's a pity he didn't succeed!

Dynamic.Part: She already is. We all are. Because of this!

Subtitles.Static: It's just a matter of time before they'll be back.
We need you now, Trent. Ready?

Dynamic.Part: What?!

Subtitles.Static: And we're not going without you!

Dynamic.Part: We're not leaving without him. I hope you know what you're doing.

Subtitles.Static: What do you say we find this Kress and get the hell out of here?

Dynamic.Part: We're looking for a man. We have reason to believe he's in the area.
He is considered an enemy of Rheinland.
Anyone caught hiding him would face severe consequences.

Subtitles.Static: We can be patient, Mr Tobias. Rest assured, we won't be far.
Tobias is better off far away from us. As long as we have the artefact, none of us will be safe. We'll be lucky to get out of here in one piece.
There you are! Trent, do you think Tobias will be all right? Maybe he should come with us.
We should take the trade lane to Stokes, and from there we'll jump to the Tau-31 System.
We don't have any time to waste. Let's go.
We told you we wouldn't be far. Give up the artefact – all exits out of this system are blocked. You cannot get out!
I'm picking up new contacts coming in very fast!
Looks like the whole damn Rheinland fleet!
This is the Rheinland Battleship Schiller. Cut your engines and deactivate your weapons system. Prepare to be boarded.
To all ships: we have unidentified targets on an intercept course.
All fighter wings: break and attack!
This is Razor Leader: concentrate your fire on the heavy cruiser.
Professor Quintaine, Colonel Kress sent us to help you...
No time to explain – we're uploading coordinates. Professor, you and the freighter have to fly there as quickly as you can, we'll try to hold off the Rheinland fleet.
Quintaine escorts, we could use your help. Engage the Rheinland ships. We have to buy the Professor time to get away!
Alpha leader to all ships: fire at will!
Red Alert! The Schiller is hit! Man all turrets! All other fighters: engage enemy ships!
Juni, maybe you and Sinclair should stay with the ships.

Dynamic.Part: Don't go and do that.

Subtitles.Static: Now that I got your attention, take us to see the Colonel.
Quiet! We just need to find Kress.
My name is Quintaine. I'm here to see Kress.
Oh, like everything else hasn't been?
Hey, thanks for keeping me out of danger. Unbelievable!

Dynamic.Part: Doctor Quintaine.
I'm pleased to see that you're all right after all.

Subtitles.Static: And you brought protection. Very wise. Please tell him to stand down.
Come, Doctor Quintaine. We have much to talk about.

Dynamic.Part: Colonel Kress sees no-one.
He sees no-one!

Subtitles.Static: I think, my friend, you misunderstand your position.
Now, I'm sorry. Maybe it's because people have been shooting at me everywhere I've gone.
But why should you care what happens to us?

Dynamic.Part: Give me a straight answer. Who do you work for, Colonel?

Subtitles.Static: No dice, Kress. I'm going myself.
No. But if, as you say, your enemies are our enemies, you won't deny me this.

Dynamic.Part: Thank you. We'll need a place to continue our research.

Subtitles.Static: Well, if I'm right, there's something we've overlooked. We need the Proteus Tome.
It's kept in a sealed titanium cylinder in the archives.

Dynamic.Part: I think it holds the answer to the artefact.
Let me offer you the sanctuary of my base.
We have facilities at your disposal, of course.

Subtitles.Static: You see, we've had our eye on Doctor Quintaine and his research for quite sometime.

Dynamic.Part: When Doctor Sinclair made her discovery it caused quite a stir among our enemies.

Subtitles.Static: So much so that her object was stolen from her and Quintaine became a marked man.
That's when it was decided that I was to intervene personally.

Dynamic.Part: Let's just say that your enemies are our enemies.

Subtitles.Static: My operation is only one cell in the larger organization.

Dynamic.Part: Despite what you may have heard, we are only interested in freedom and peace.
Hmph! I understand your suspicion, but
we are not guilty of nearly as much as your media would suggest.

Subtitles.Static: For now, please accept my hospitality in the spirit in which it is offered.
Tell me, what else do you require of me?

Dynamic.Part: Very well. That shouldn't be difficult, we have an agent in Kusari who may be useful for this...
Lord Hakkera. He's a local potentate. He can arrange for its... liberation.

Subtitles.Static: You don't really trust me, do you, Mr Trent?

Dynamic.Part: If that's so, then why all of the attacks?
It's a peace of parchment that rests in the Natural History Museum in Kusari.
You see, the Artifact and the Panels have given us a lot of
insight, but they both refer back to a missing piece of text.

Subtitles.Static: Take the trade lane. Trent, you go first. I'll cover the rear.
Where have you been, Professor? The colonies are at the brink of war. Rheinland ships have been sighted in just about every system.
We're coming up on Stokes. Stay sharp!
We've got incoming. Trent! Keep them away from Sinclair and Quintaine.
Negative, Stokes! There's no time. We have to get out of Leeds. Trent, take the trade lane!
Trent, Sinclair and Quintaine need enough time to get through the gate. No matter what awaits us there, we have to buy them as much time as we can and then jump to Tau-31.
Trent, engage the cruiser. Try to knock out their turrets!
Trent, take point. We'll follow you.
Radar is clear! Looks like we managed to shake them!
It's strange that there are no ships around here. Outpost Holman? Please come in...
There you are! We were about to turn around and look for you. Are you being followed?
I've taken some readings. It seems to be phase-aligned. We should be able to use it.
We're just near Shinkaku station, Trent. I've uploaded the coordinates. Take the lead.
Hard to believe it all hinges on a message to some bartender. I hope this Kress wasn't playing games... or setting a trap.
We should all land to make repairs and re-arm ourselves. Trent, you go first.
Guess what? There actually was a message for Quintaine.
I understand. Thank you for everything, Tobias.
All right everybody, let's get moving.
Be careful in the methane field. Certain pockets are explosive and could damage our ships.
In case we run into Rheinland ships, use your cruise engines or your afterburners to get to the Oxygen field on the far side of the system. We'll regroup there.
I thought it was over. How did you find us?
Trent, I've uploaded the coordinates. Let's go!
We need to get to Kusari space.
We'll talk to you soon, Professor.
Thank you. All right, Trent, go ahead.
We're in the Ohka Dust Field. We'll head to planet Aso and take the trade lane from there to Kyushu.
It's funny – I used to fly around this asteroid field when I was younger. My grandmother lives on Tsushima station above Aso. I haven't been back here in over a decade.
We're almost there. Take the trade lane to Kyushu.
Trent, land and I'll follow you in. Lord Hakkera will be waiting for us in the bar.
I cannot believe they continue to attack us in the middle of Bretonia territory.
Oh my! A Rheinlander cruiser is blocking the gate! We don't stand a chance!
You have our gratitude, Mr Tobias!
The night I met Kress, he told me that if I wanted to find him, I should talk to the bartender on Shinkaku. Is that a planet?
I'm taking heavy damage. My ship won't be able to take much more!
Not functional? You mean this is a dead end?!?
Once again, we are in your debt, Mr Tobias.
It could be. We need to find a safe haven and perform a thorough analysis of the object.
I will land and talk to the bartender.
Apparently, the Kress base is not far – it's in a secret location on the far side of this system. The bartender gave me a set of coordinates. I'm uploading them now.
We have to be careful. The bartender warned me that Rheinland ships have been sighted in the area. He suggested that we fly through the methane field – it should mask our engine signatures.
Not much. He told me that Kress frequently operates in this area and then he gave me these coordinates. That's all.
Unfortunately, the field will only provide us with cover for half of the way – after that, we'll have to fly through open space.
We're at the edge of the field. From now on, we're without cover.
This is Quintaine, we made it! We're at the coordinates.
Are you taking us to Kress?

Dynamic.Part: This is Quintaine. Kress managed to contact his agent, Lord Hakkera. He is waiting for you on planet Kyushu.
Please contact me when you have the Proteus Tome. In the meantime, Sinclair and I will continue to study the artefact. Good luck.

Subtitles.Static: Open fire, chaps. We have to take out that cruiser!
Trent, a fleet of Rheinland ships is only minutes behind us. We have little time.
Destroy the fighters and let's get out of here!
Glasgow, we have to get these people out of here. The jump-gate needs to be locked after we jump through.
The Bretonia military has been alerted. They will be here soon. Good luck, Glasgow. Go, Trent! Activate the jump-gate. I'll see you on the other side.
When I heard about the incident at Stokes, I knew you were in trouble. I called a few friends from my old flying days and we came as quickly as possible.
Ah, enough already! We have to get out of here.
We're heading towards the IMG Outpost Holman, it's the only base in this entire system. Where were you planning to go?
That's a Samura station. It was built right next to the large methane field in Tau-29. A bit remote, but not too far from here.
We're coming up on Holman. Keep your eyes open. If there are Rheinlanders, we won't have the element of surprise this time.
The next trade lane takes us to the Tau-29 gate. From there, it's just a short flight to Shinkaku.
It's a trap! We only have one chance – quick, let's get out of here!
No! It was not his fight.
This is the trade lane to the new Tau-23 gate. It's under construction on this end, but we should be able to use it.
The lane should be usable from here on. Everybody, into the trade lane, quick!
Hmm. The Tau-23 gate is not functional yet. Our best option is Planet Harris, but it's pretty far from here.
We cannot make it to Planet Harris from here, but there's an intermittent jump-hole nearby. It might not work, but it's our only option. I'm uploading the coordinates!
We need to buy them some time! Trent, you and I will stay here and fight the gunships. Everybody else: get to that jump-hole and wait for us there.
Trent, where are you going? You have to stay here and fight!
All right, Trent! It's you and I against two gunships! Let's see how much you've learned since you left Leeds!
Target their engines! That's their weakest spot!
Trent, that's enough. The others should be at the jump-hole. Let's get out of here!
Ha ha ha ha! We're not such easy prey after all, eh!
They're not following us! Hopefully, the jump-hole will be phase-aligned. If not, we're in big trouble.
You did well back there, boy! I'm proud of you.
You're getting soft in your old age, boy! I expected you to make more of a dent in that fight.
No! We have to leave the system. What's the status of the jump-hole?
Good! What are we waiting for? Let's go! Trent, you go first. I will make sure that no Rheinlanders are following us.
Hmm, there's no sign of them, but I'm sure they'll be back. We need to keep moving.
If Rheinland keeps openly attacking targets in Bretonia, it could easily lead to a full-scale war.
My friends, I will take my leave from you now. If there is indeed a war coming between Rheinland and Bretonia, I am needed at home.
We will meet again, I promise. Trent, get these people to safety and find out what this artefact of yours is all about. Good luck to all of you!
Tobias, we will hold them off. Get these people to safety. Run!
Damn it, he cloaked! We've got to get away from here.
That Rheinlander said that all exits out of Leeds are blocked. What do we do?
Let's hope the jump-gate is clear. It's the only way out of Leeds.
My ship is taking heavy damage!
I don't understand. Do you think all of this is happening because of the artefact?
What did the bartender say about Kress?
Our reactor is hit! We're losing containment! Ahhhhhhh!
This is the Nestor! All wings, take out these pirates!
We've been hit! The hull is buckling and giving way... we're losing integrity... Ahhhh!
We'll meet again. You'll never make it out of Bretonia alive!
I told you we'd meet again. For the last time, surrender the artefact.
This is the end. You have nowhere else to run. Give up, now!
You fools! You will be destroyed...
...are in violation of the Boorman Treaty. Leave this area at once!
This is Stokes Smelter. We are under attack by Rheinland warships and need assistance!
Repeat, this is Stokes Smelter. We are under attack and need assistance!
Unknown ships, this is Stokes Smelter. Large numbers of Rheinland ships have been reported throughout Leeds. We recommend you land and wait till the crisis is over.

Dynamic.Part: ...emergency generators. This is Outpost Glasgow.
To all Bretonian ships, we're under attack by a Rheinland strike force and have sustained heavy damage!

Subtitles.Static: This is Outpost Glasgow to all Bretonian ships. We're under attack. Repeat: we are under attack.
This is Glasgow. Radar is clear, no more enemy contacts. You came just in time!
Razor One, your party is cleared to land.
Bull's eye! All units engage! Hit them fast and hit them hard!
We have them on the run!
Excellent! All fighters: disengage and return home.
The bartender on Shinkaku contacted us. Kress immediately sent us to find you.
Rheinland ships have been spotted in this system for several days now. When we heard that Quintaine was on Shinkaku, we knew he would likely run into trouble.
We should be safe now, but we need to keep moving. The jump-hole to Tau-23 is near.
Yes. Colonel Kress is currently a guest of the Outcasts. He'll be pleased to see you, Professor.
It's not far from here to the base. I'm uploading the coordinates.
We're in Tau-23. Not too many people know about this system. It's fully within the Barrier. Both BMM and IMG are maintaining bases here since rich deposits of Beryllium and Niobium have been found.
This is Razor One. We're bringing a visitor to Colonel Kress. We're expected.
Professor, land on the base. Kress is awaiting your arrival.
Colonel Kress asked me to escort you out of this system. What's your destination?
You're lucky, there's a jump-hole nearby that will get you there in no time.
This is where we part ways. This jump-hole leads directly to Kyushu. Best of luck to ya!

Dynamic.Part: I'm sorry, you're just not what I expected.

Subtitles.Static: That's it? What are we supposed to do now? Wait?

Dynamic.Part: What am I supposed to do around here while you're gone?
Like hell we will. I have contacts here, too.
But to get to them, we'll have to split up for a while.
Ey, you should try to fit in a little, maybe get some work. By the sound of things, this may take a while.

Subtitles.Static: Don't worry, I won't be far.
I was told you would be coming. I'm Lord Hakkera, I am the Prefect of Honshu.

Dynamic.Part: Is there a problem?
You expected a terrorist, then?

Subtitles.Static: I serve The Order to help my people, Mr Trent.
I understand that you are here for the Proteus Tome.
Unfortunately, that will not be easy. The artefacts in the museum have come under renewed scrutiny.
I will need to secure special permission for us to be allowed access.
Please excuse me. I've recently lost contact with one of my operatives in Rheinland. This may be news.
I will be in touch once I get access to the Proteus Tome.
Yeah. I was starting to wonder if we were partners any more.
What do you mean? That's why we came!
Why not? I've come this far, haven't I?
Wait! Kusari has a resistance movement?

Dynamic.Part: I think I do.

Subtitles.Static: That's right. The Proteus Tome. It's fallen under the control of Governor Tekagi.
How much time do we have?

Dynamic.Part: He's defecting?
I'm sorry Juni. It's not that I don't trust you.

Subtitles.Static: I just need more time before I take another blind leap.
I said I just needed a little time!
I just had to dig a little deeper than I thought.
Trent, I heard from Lord Hakkera. He says that the Proteus Tome and
all of the museum artefacts have now come under the personal control of Governor Tekagi.

Dynamic.Part: Hakkera can't help us.
You have to understand Kusari customs, Hakkera is a Lord.
His position gives him power, but also limits him. There's only so much he can do before he violates his station.
Anyway, I'm on to something, but you'll have to trust me on this one.

Subtitles.Static: If we do this, we do it together, understand? Are you in?
One last thing, the man you're about to meet is very high up in the Kusari resistance.
Whatever you do, don't mention my affiliation with the LSF.
Ozu, this is Trent, the man I told you about.

Dynamic.Part: Ozu is a lieutenant in the Blood Dragons, a counter-political group that opposes the Shogun.

Subtitles.Static: Trent, Tekagi is a traitor to his people.

Dynamic.Part: No?

Subtitles.Static: What are you doing back here?
Do we? I thought that was over when you walked out on me last time.
So are you saying you're ready to trust me now?
Ah, Mr Trent. Jun'ko speaks highly of you. Please, sit.
Since Jun'ko's departure to Liberty many things have changed here.

Dynamic.Part: The old ways are dying out as we become more of a melting pot of cultures.
Do you understand?
The one thing that has not changed is the face of treachery.
It is something that we have fought for many generations.
The reason the Blood Dragons have survived

Subtitles.Static: is because of our ability to adapt and change, to out-manoeuvre the stronger opponent.

Dynamic.Part: This would not be possible without carefully nurtured relationships, Mr Trent.
Which brings me to you.
I am told that you and The Order seek a certain artefact.
Yes. Tekagi.

Subtitles.Static: He has been acting strangely, even for him, since his return from Rheinland.

Dynamic.Part: Our sources now say that there is a secret transport being loaded with these artefacts bound from Tekagi

Subtitles.Static: We believe the Proteus Tome is one of those on board.

Dynamic.Part: Little! Particularly since Tekagi himself may be on that transport.

Subtitles.Static: We believe so. With an offering to his new lord and master, the Chancellor.
Again, the face of treachery has not changed.

Dynamic.Part: Our vendetta with Tekagi is an old one.
Unfortunately, we may only have this one last opportunity to repay him for his crimes.

Subtitles.Static: Mr Trent, here is what I propose.
You and The Order shall have what you desire, if you help rid us of Tekagi.
He deserves to die. Do us this service.
Trent! It took a while, but I finally found what we're looking for. Meet me in the New Tokyo system. It's urgent.
Why are we taking a jump-hole?
How do we get to the transport?
I have the coordinates. Trent, you take the lead.
Kyoto? Trent, that's the legendary home of the Blood Dragons. I don't know anyone who's ever seen it. Ozu, you honour us.
Mr Trent, we will take the trade lane from here to the Honshu gate.
My sources tell me that the Tekagi's transport is currently docked at the Yukawa shipyard in Honshu. It is heavily guarded. Apparently they are taking additional cargo onboard.
That is very possible. Yukawa is a Kishiro base and Tekagi owns a large portion of that organisation.
I have made plans to rendezvous with a Blood Dragon attack force before we attack the transports.
We are not going through the jump-gate, Mr Trent. Blood Dragon fighters are awaiting us at a nearby jump-hole. I'm uploading the coordinates.
Tekagi is a powerful man, Jun'ko. He has spies everywhere. If we want to have a chance to capture the transport, we need to take them by surprise.
Enter formation and follow us to the jump-hole.
The Blood Dragons are small in numbers, Jun'ko. But they are the best fighter pilots in the colonies.
There is the jump-hole, Mr Trent. Please go first.
We don't have any time to waste. Let's go!
We have to hit them quickly and decisively. First, we target the weapon platforms, then the fighter escorts.
We have a strike force positioned on Yukawa that will seize control of the transport. Once we've eliminated the fighters, our people will fly the transport out of there.
The nebula will cover us most of the way, but the final approach will be in open space. We will have to fly as fast as possible before their scanners detect us. Every second will count.
There is the shipyard. Is everybody ready?
Our first targets are the weapon platforms! All ships, engage!
Quickly, take out the other one. We're taking heavy fire from its turrets.
The second platform is down! Ozu to strike team: operation is a go! All ships, take out the escort fighters.
We have lost a fighter. We need to cover each other!
We have lost another ship. This is getting close!
We're down to one fighter. Jun'ko, Mr. Trent, we have to take out the hostile fighters!
Our last fighter is down. Jun'ko, Mr. Trent, it's up to us now!
One of their fighters is down. Engage the other fighters!
Another escort fighter destroyed! Hold on! I have a report from the strike team. They caught Tekagi's men off guard and have them pinned down.
To all ships! The strike team has successfully taken over the transport. Disengage and protect the transport.
Strike team, what is your status?
Jun'ko, Mr Trent, we have to destroy these fighters before we jump.
Proceed to the jump-hole. We should be safe now.
This is the jump-hole to the Chugoku system. Mr Trent, please go first.
This is Lieutenant Ozu. Stand down, patrol. We have captured Tekagi's transport and are escorting it back to Kyoto as ordered.
We are almost there. Jun'ko, Mr Trent. Follow me.
Here we will celebrate our victory over Tekagi and Edo. Here you shall receive what you came for. I will see you shortly.
We have you in range. Standing by for orders.
The transport is still docking with Yukawa, Ozu-sensei, but it looked like they were about to leave. I counted multiple heavy weapon platforms and strong fighter protection. It won't be easy.
We lost two of our men, Sensei, but it was worth it. The cargo pods are full of gold, diamonds and thousands of artefacts.
We're hit! We've lost pressure in one compartment. We cannot take much more damage!
Identify yourself or you will be destroyed.

Dynamic.Part: Lieutenant Ozu, this is amazing. How long have the Blood Dragons been here in this asteroid?

Subtitles.Static: Tell me, how long have you known Ozu?

Dynamic.Part: What happened?

Subtitles.Static: So what do we do now?

Dynamic.Part: Joining the ranks of the radical left?

Subtitles.Static: You mean was he always a radical in the Blood Dragons?

Dynamic.Part: No. When I knew him he was to be a promising political student at the Kusari Academy.
People are changed by their world, Trent, rarely vice versa.
Ozu is living proof of that.

Subtitles.Static: He wanted for us to at least have a choice of what world would shape us.
Since he was from Liberty and my mother was from here, we followed his diplomatic ties to Manhattan.

Dynamic.Part: Well, I can't just sit here. Maybe the Blood Dragons could use a little help.

Subtitles.Static: I'm not on assignment any more, Trent. I get to see how the other side lives.

Dynamic.Part: You know, it wouldn't hurt you to get out there for a while either. Maybe take some missions.
From the sound of things it may be a while. Don't worry, I'll let you know when we hear something.
Several generations.

Subtitles.Static: With Tekagi eliminated, the Edo Shogunate is weaker and our victory is near.

Dynamic.Part: [sigh] I'm afraid we have been deceived.
This was the right shipment, but we have neither the artefacts nor Tekagi.
He was not on the transport as we were lead to believe. Something has changed.

Subtitles.Static: I will make the necessary enquiries.
For now, I suggest that you occupy yourselves with whatever diversions we can offer.
Okay. Let's do it. Have you told Juni yet?
I'm not ready to go up against Tekagi's men so soon.

Dynamic.Part: Ah, I'm glad you have arrived. I have news.
As we feared, Governor Tekagi is indeed alive. I am told that he has secretly left the palace

Subtitles.Static: and has moved the artefacts to his fortified retreat – a remote planetoid with many defences.
But I have come up with a plan that should get us both what we want. Shall we proceed?
This is for us alone, Mr Trent.
Come, we have no time to waste. My attack squad is ready. I'll brief you in space.
I must say I expected more.
I must say I am surprised to see you again.

Dynamic.Part: Ozu, we're losing ships left and right. We have to retreat! Good luck!
Do you think Tekagi's gone?
We'll soon find out.
Some plan! Just shoot everything. I could have done that myself.
Sometimes the simplest solutions are the best.
The Tome?
There!
The Proteus Tome!
Now for Tekagi...
Think it will be that easy, do you?
Well, as you said, sometimes the simplest solutions...
Neural gas!
Locked!
Not for long. Stand back! [coughs]
Breathtaking, isn't it?
It is one of a kind.
Much like this.
You and your Dragon friend here have broken into my home
and killed my servants.
To deprive me of the Proteus Tome and my life.
Why?
WHY?!?
Now, now – keep your seat.
I wouldn't want anything bad to happen to you.
Not until we have had a chance to talk, Mr Trent!
Leave us.
So, what's to keep me from killing you right now and taking the Tome?
I think I'm more than a match for the two of you.
On the other hand, maybe I should even the odds.
Unnnhhh...
Ozu!
Be sure, Mr Trent. Do you really know with whom you are dealing?
You're going to tell me what I want to know.
About the Tome, The Order – everything!
Hakkera...
Get down!
Aah!
Eh?
Quickly! Get to your ship!

Subtitles.Static: Mr. Trent. I have new information about the Proteus Tome and Governor Tekagi. It is imperative that you return to Kyoto as soon as possible.

Dynamic.Part: Mr Trent, my informants report that Tekagi is preparing to leave his fortress. We have little time.
Tekagi's arch is only one system away from here, in Tohoku. The Blood Dragons discovered a jump-hole to there over 20 years ago. I'm uploading the coordinates.

Subtitles.Static: We are attempting to retrieve the Proteus Tome, Jun'ko. We're flying to Tekagi's arch.
This is our last chance, Jun'ko. Tekagi is leaving for Rheinland.
We have decided to attack Tegaki's base with full force. We will find the Tome... and kill Tekagi. Wish us luck! Ozu out!
We're approaching the hole now. It will bring us very close to his base.
There it is... Mr Trent, go ahead and jump. A fighter wing is awaiting us on the other side.
We're flying to a nearby outpost of the Blood Dragons. I'm uploading the coordinates.
We have to be careful. This system is littered with hidden defence systems and patrol wings.
We have to destroy those ships. Engage!
Mr Trent, this is the Tohoku planetary arch. Once one of the wonders of Kusari ingenuity, now it is a fortress of deceit and evil. Dragons! Proceed to the target!
No contacts so far... maybe we're lucky.
Dragon 1, we must take out these gunboats at all costs!
Outpost Ryuku, this is Lieutenant Ozu.
If Tekagi escapes, we will forever miss our opportunity to retrieve the Tome and end that demon's life. We have to hurry.
Dragon 2, you know his base defences – what is our best option?
We're out of time. The Dragons are being shot to pieces. Our distraction is not working!
We have to land! I'm under heavy fire!
Good work! I will meet you on the deck.
Mr Trent! Don't fly too far away! You are needed here!
You don't leave me to fight the enemy alone, Mr Trent!
There are too many of them! I'm retreating!
Trent! Ozu! I heard you're leaving, what's going on?
No! That's suicide! The arch is too well defended.
Got 'em! That should set them back for a while. We have to get the hell out of here, come on!
Lord Hakkera, what is going on?
How long have you known about these Nomads?
All right, people! Here we go!
Trent, I need help over here!
Acknowledge. Trent, watch yourself. This is gonna get rough.
There is a lot of activity in this system, Lieutenant. Tekagi has drastically increased his patrols within the last few hours. It almost seems like he is expecting an attack.
Mr Trent, take the lead. We'll follow you.
This is Dragon 1. Ready to assist!
Understood. Long live the Blood Dragons!
Tekagi will use whatever means he has at his disposal to stop us.

Dynamic.Part: You and Mr Trent should approach from beneath the base.
Located there is a large cylindrical stabiliser used to reinforce the structure of the planetoid. The safest approach would be through this opening.
We will attempt to occupy his forces and draw them away from the base. That should buy you enough time to break in... hopefully unnoticed.

Subtitles.Static: Damn it! Lieutenant Ozu, make your run.
We lost another ship. Ozu, you have to get into the arch now, we can't hold them back!
We're being picked off like flies. Ozu, you have to hurry!
We can't withstand this firepower much longer. Hurry!
We have to get back to Kyoto. I'm sending you the jump-hole coordinates. Hurry!
He didn't make it. He sacrificed his life to end Tekagi's reign.
We can talk about this more later. I will explain when we are in Chugoku.
We've reached the jump-hole. Mr Trent, please go first.
He was killed by a Nomad. We only know a few things about them. They are a species with the ability to possess Humans and have been slowly infiltrating the colonies.
It appears that they are mostly targeting high-ranking government and military officials. Tekagi was one of these people. Up until today, no-one had ever seen a Nomad and lived to talk about it.

Dynamic.Part: Before we ever met. The Order was founded to protect us from the Nomads.
About two months ago, a Rheinland expedition to an uncharted planet found... something.
Soon after that, key positions in the Rheinland government were replaced and Rheinland's politics became more and more aggressive.

Subtitles.Static: We believe these Nomads attempted to infiltrate the Liberty government when Admiral Schultzky came to visit Manhattan. We had to prevent this at all costs, which is why we destroyed the Donau.
We're approaching Kyoto. This is Lord Hakkera. We are on approach.
Our mission was successful. We have the Proteus Tome and Lord Tekagi is dead. But we paid a high price for this: Lieutenant Ozu is gone.
My radar is showing new enemies.
We are on our way to your position.
We have been awaiting you for some time, Lord Hakkera. What news do you bring?
Understood! Long live the Dragons! His sacrifice was not in vain. You are cleared to land.
Lieutenant, we have monitored your operation and are standing by. Our forces are at your disposal.
Long-range radar indicates that there are a large number of ships assembled in the area near the arch. It appears Tekagi is leaving his fortress.
We are uploading the coordinates of the arch into your Neural Net. Long live the Dragons!

Dynamic.Part: Can you really be so callous about him being killed like that?
Well, I didn't. Why didn't anyone tell me?

Subtitles.Static: I know this is hard to absorb, Mr Trent. But Rheinland is not our only enemy in this conflict.

Dynamic.Part: More sacrifices are being made than you will ever hear in the news.
Men like Ozu are dying every day.
He knew the risks.

Subtitles.Static: What? That we were being invaded by an alien force we didn't understand?

Dynamic.Part: That we had finally come up against something that was more powerful than our own hubris?
Hmm? Would that have helped?
That's why The Order was formed, Trent! The peace we are fighting for!
That's why it was so important for you and brave Ozu
to get that thing at all costs.

Subtitles.Static: Because it's important to the Nomads!

Dynamic.Part: There. Now you know!
How does it feel, Freelancer?
Yeah?
Right.
Hakkera, I need some time.

Subtitles.Static: Alright, Hakkera, I'm here. Partly thanks to you. What did you have in mind?

Dynamic.Part: No. Lord Hakkera was just telling me about Ozu.

Subtitles.Static: How he died. I'm glad you made it back, though.
Unnecessary, but there is one thing that I do need your help with, if you're up to it.
Well, Mr Trent? Will you help me?

Dynamic.Part: Do you remember when we first met and I had lost contact with an operative of mine in Rheinland?

Subtitles.Static: His name is Von Claussen. He is an agent for The Order who operates deep in Rheinland space.

Dynamic.Part: He apparently has discovered vital information about Rheinland's plans,

Subtitles.Static: but we've had trouble contacting him. He is in terrible danger.
His only chance is to be extracted.
New Berlin. You're perfect for the job because Bretonia is still neutral.
I would ask Miss Zane to go, but for obvious reasons that would be inappropriate.

Dynamic.Part: And besides, I am sending her back with the Proteus Tome to Doctor Quintaine.

Subtitles.Static: You must leave at once, Mr Trent. I will make sure you have all the information you may need. Come along, Jun'ko.

Dynamic.Part: That is one commodity we do no have. However,
I believe that you are Von Claussen's best chance of survival, so I will wait until you are ready.

Subtitles.Static: So! Have you decided to help me after all?
Hmm. Does he speak for himself?

Dynamic.Part: And what about you?
Why?

Subtitles.Static: My good sir! May we interest you in a reading for what the future may hold for you?
Mr Blix here is never wrong about such things. He says you're looking for someone.

Dynamic.Part: Mr Blix has connections to sources on a higher plane.
No. Not I, sir. I was gifted with being a listener.
Together we are the eyes and ears for certain people who are willing to pay for such divine services.

Subtitles.Static: We are in the employ of one such man now. The man you seek.

Dynamic.Part: You see, we have been waiting for you for some time.
You are to meet Herr Von Claussen on the old terraforming platform on the planet Holstein.
Within the Frankfurt System.

Subtitles.Static: Don't worry, Mr Trent. The gods are smiling upon you.

Dynamic.Part: When you get there the time will be right.
[cacophony]
Von Claussen...
I understand. Now, let's get you out of here while we still can.
Are you Mr Trent?
You weren't followed, were you?

Subtitles.Static: Good. I can't say how pleased I am to see you. Jonner and Blix told me you were coming.
A man in my position can never be too careful.

Dynamic.Part: Blix took the liberty of reading your thoughts while you were on New Berlin.
I'm sorry for the intrusion. I had to be sure that whoever Hakkera sent had not been tampered with.
No argument here, Mr Trent.

Subtitles.Static: The Bundschuh? I've never heard of them.

Dynamic.Part: No, I don't. But I am willing to help you finish what you started.

Subtitles.Static: They're good people, Trent. Good people in a bad land.

Dynamic.Part: Yes, my saviour, Trent. This is Claus Botzler.
Leader of the Bundschuh rebels. How are you holding out?
Excellent, my friend! Today we will put a stop to the Chancellor's secret weapon.

Subtitles.Static: Trent, you have no idea how difficult it was to betray my world in order to save it.

Dynamic.Part: Thank you.
Herr Von Claussen, I'm glad to see you made it. And this must be your way out.

Subtitles.Static: Very badly, I'm afraid. The Rheinland regulars have been hitting us with everything they've got recently.

Dynamic.Part: But we are still ready for you. Our attack wing will meet you both at the rendezvous point as planned.
Trent, according to my sources, the Rheinland Military is amassing a fleet at a secret installation not far from here.
We must strike this installation in order to slow the growing Rheinland war machine. If we are successful, this strike will greatly delay the Rheinland war plans.

Subtitles.Static: Our sensors are unable to penetrate the field, so we have no tactical information about fleet positions or even the installation itself. Despite this, we must strike this installation.
This operation is vital to the survival of both Rheinland and Kusari. If this war is allowed to progress, none shall survive. Stay alert and await my orders once we reach the end of the passage.
Be careful everyone! While the radiation in the field will damage your ship, the mine field is significantly more deadly. Stay calm and fly right. Let's go.

Dynamic.Part: This will not be an easy operation. The installation is surrounded by a radioactive field that has been further reinforced by mines.
In addition, there is only one known way in and out of the field, a small passage located to the east of the field. Our scouts report that it is no more than 100 metres wide.

Subtitles.Static: Be wary of the narrow passage. The mines are low yield but will still do quite a bit of damage to your ship.
We're here. All fighters break formation!
Right before I landed on Holstein, Hakkera told me that there's a change of plans. The Order will send ships to meet us in the Hamburg System.
This is Battleship Freya. Identify yourselves.
Acknowledged. DHC-3417, you're cleared to proceed.
We made it! Where are the Order ships?
All fighters, arm weapons and prepare to engage on passage exit.
Herr Von Claussen, I'm picking up another passage on the far side of the interior, we must use this passage as our means of escape. We will not survive a head on fight with the capital ships.
Keep trying! That station must fall! Those Nomad battleships must not be allowed to survive!
This act will not go unpunished!
No! My men will not have died in vain!
Just go, and tell your compatriots what you've seen and what awaits them! Go! While there's still time!
–under attack! This is Bundschuh base Bruchsal. All friendly units, please respond!
Scanners are picking up another wing of Rheinland fighters!
Herr Von Claussen! The Bundschuh are thankful for your assistance.
Herr Botzler, the Rheinland battleships are keeping us away from the installation. We can't get a good shot.
The Blood Dragons know of an uncharted jump-hole in Sigma-13 that can take you all the way to New Berlin if we move quickly. We will escort you there, then you are on your own.
Lord Hakkera, we are near the jump-hole to Sigma-13.
With the Liberty Fleet advancing into Kepler, Kusari will get crushed in the middle.
This jump-hole will take you to New Berlin. This is as far as Lord Hakkera and I can go. Kusari citizens in Rheinland are being arrested on sight – or worse.
I'm Hans Fischer, a friend of Mr Blix. He asked me to accompany you on your way to Holstein. Follow me.
We're taking the trade lane to the Frankfurt gate.
I'm also a good friend of Herr Von Claussen. He and I have been providing Lord Hakkera with information ever since the Nomads infiltrated the Rheinland government.
Freya, this is Daumann Freighter DHC-3417. We're transporting supplies to Planet Holstein.
We're approaching the trade lane. Take the lead.

Dynamic.Part: The Rheinland Military has been brutally suppressing any and all opposition to the war with Kusari.
We're about to pass by Mannheim Station. Word is that the military has detained hundreds of journalists and activists there. Nobody knows if they're alive or dead.

Subtitles.Static: We're coming up on Holstein. It's the water planet on our right. So far so good!
Here we are. I've got a rendezvous with a Bundschuh agent on the south-western continent. Give my regards to Herr Von Claussen. Good luck, Trent.
This is Hakkera! Trent, Mr Von Claussen, land quickly. We have to get away before more Rheinland ships enter the area.
Trent, change of plans. Take the lead.
We just got news that Rheinland has invaded the Sigma systems. All bases and jump-gates there are now under Rheinland control. But there is another option.
Trent, I will follow you through.
There is no time for this, Trent. Take the Jump Hole!
You dishonor yourself and the Order. Cobo, come with me.
We have to be careful. According to our informants, a large Rheinland fleet is amassing in this area. Mr Trent, take the lead.
The reports were accurate. Rheinland seems to be moving their entire Northern Fleet into Sigma.
Trent, the jump-hole is near. We have to make a run for it!
They have bigger fish to catch than us.
What you see here are the remains of the decisive battle in the 80-Year War between Rheinland and the GMG. The jump-hole is directly ahead of us.
Von Claussen is awaiting you on New Berlin. It is imperative that we bring him out alive. Good luck, Trent.
Why are you still in this system, Trent? Von Claussen needs to get out of Rheinland. You must leave while the Jump Hole is still active!
The Jump Hole has closed. You dishonor yourself and the Order, Trent.
Trent, Hakkera here. We hear that Von Claussen's safe-house has been penetrated. He's on the run. You have to find him quickly!
This is Hakkera. Trent, you have greatly disappointed me.

Dynamic.Part: Trent, this is Hakkera. We have a slight change to our extraction plan. It is no longer possible for you to return to Kusari. The Rheinland fleet has invaded Honshu.
We will rendezvous with you in the Hamburg System. I will transmit precise coordinates later. Hakkera out.

Subtitles.Static: We have hostiles in Sector C8!
Perfect! That fits well into my plans. I have a piece of unfinished business I want to take care of. We have to fly to a nearby rebel base.
An informant recently supplied me with construction blueprints for a new type of vessel being built by the Rheinland Military. It's unlike any other ship, Mr Trent. The design is alien.
I have contacted a friend of mine who leads a rebel group that opposes the new Rheinland regime. Their base is not far from here.
This is Von Claussen. We are engaging the Rheinlanders.
And still he attacks! Rheinlander! Don't you see? Today you will die!
You're welcome. Trent, go ahead and dock. I will follow.
Sensors show the passage is opening up into a huge open area. We are also picking up a massive installation. That will be our target.
For the sake of peace, that installation must fall – at all costs!
All remaining fighters! Break and hit the installation. Hit whatever you can!
Sensors indicate that those are battleship-class Nomads moored with the station. If we take out the station, those vessels will be destroyed as well.
All fighters! Hit the installation with everything you have!
We simply can't do enough damage to the installation!
No time left, we've got to get out of here. We've done everything we can. Our best hope now is to warn Kusari of this fleet.
Trent, we've got to go now. We can't let Botzler's sacrifice be in vain.
Trent! I can't wait for you. I'm heading for the exit passage. I will meet you on the other side.
There, the jump-hole! Navigation systems indicate that it leads to the Hamburg System. That is our way out, Trent.
Excellent! You made it! Come on, Trent. We have to get out of here before more Rheinland ships come after us. Take the Jump Hole.
What are you doing? Dock with the jump hole!
That's it. You're not getting me killed.

Dynamic.Part: Juni, you're here. How did you...?

Subtitles.Static: Who makes off with an entire ship without getting caught?

Dynamic.Part: So, Mr Orillion, you used to work for Liberty?
You mean the Nomads.

Subtitles.Static: So why not just attack us outright?

Dynamic.Part: So the Chancellor is a host body for the Nomads, too?
We had to move the operation. The artefacts, the research – everything!

Subtitles.Static: Quintaine and Sinclair are conferring with Orillion now.
Yes, Trent. This is his flagship.

Dynamic.Part: And this must be...

Subtitles.Static: Come on. It's time I reacquainted you with an old friend.
It was. It's an advanced prototype they never had the chance to use.
The Order commandeered her right out from under their noses.
Because we're too strong. They had to soften us up a bit.

Dynamic.Part: That's why the Chancellor started this war in the colonies.

Subtitles.Static: Don't worry, Trent. No need to salute.

Dynamic.Part: Herr Von Claussen!

Subtitles.Static: You are here at last. Do you have the plans?
I do, thanks to Mr Trent. My compliments, Hakkera.
He's a fine addition to your group. Thank you, again.
A lot of us are. Welcome aboard the Osiris.

Dynamic.Part: A fine piece of hardware from the Liberty Naval labs.

Subtitles.Static: My name is Casper Orillion. Welcome to the Osiris and to The Order.

Dynamic.Part: For their deepest darkest. I was their top agent until I discovered the Nomads had taken over my CO.

Subtitles.Static: They wanted me too. But I managed to escape aboard this ship.
That's when I committed myself to learning everything I could about the Nomads and their plan.

Dynamic.Part: I surrounded myself with recruits from all over the colonies.
People like you two, to help rid us of the infestation..
That's right. They've been taking over Human beings from some time now, controlling them.

Subtitles.Static: As near as we can tell, this all started when a Rheinland survey team discovered an uncharted planet.
One that no Human had ever set foot on. Unfortunately, when they penetrated its crust,
the inhabitants that lived inside viewed us... as a threat.

Dynamic.Part: So when we're sufficiently thinned out, they can come in and mop up the rest.

Subtitles.Static: Isn't it obvious? Now if you'll excuse me, I have a briefing to attend. Colonel Zane?
So now the Nomads have her?
We've just got word that President Jacobi is still alive. I need you and Colonel Trent for a mission at once.
Good. A loyal group of LSF members have apparently survived
and have been monitoring the President since her abduction. She's being held in the Alaska System.
Unknown. But I want you to find out.
Rescue... or terminate. Do you understand?
Good. You are to hook up with the leader of these LSF operatives. A man named Walker.
Well, you better get ready. We need you now, Trent.
Well, Mr. Trent. I'm glad to see you've come to your senses. The President is waiting. Are you ready now?

Dynamic.Part: Eh. More of the same.

Subtitles.Static: Come on, Trent. It's time to rescue the President.
I wanted to come and say goodbye myself.
Something for Orillion. I will see you again.
It's the only one worth fighting for now. I hear you've got a line on the President.
Walker! You son of a– I thought you were dead!
Hmph, given up freelancing for a real cause? I'm impressed.
Indeed we do. But we'll have to hurry.

Dynamic.Part: I do not like the look of this.
Where is everyone?
I don't know. Looks like a trap.
Madame President, I'm glad to see you're awake.
Reed. What's the meaning of this? Ah!
I'm sorry about your shoulder. We tried to dress it as well as we could.
He requested that you be taken unharmed.
Who? Reed, you traitorous snake, who requested?
The Chancellor!
I'm glad to see these fools didn't damage you too badly, my dear. But time is short. I wanted these few minutes to plant a seed, as it were.
Any idea where they're keeping the President?
Let's find out, shall we?
I won't rest until I see you pay for this!
I understand your anger, Madame President. I was misdirected at first, too. But then I had my mind opened to... other possibilities. As you will.
[screams]
Is that the Chancellor?
Just shoot!
Madame President, are you alright?
What the hell did you want, an engraved invitation?
Look, I didn't–
You were just going to let that... that... thing attack the President?
I'm sorry, I haven't got used to killing political figures on sight yet.
Trent, did he look like a Human being to you?
I'm telling you, I–
Watch out!
Burn, you son of a bitch!

Subtitles.Static: This whole place is lit up!
Form up. Let's get out of here.
There has to be another way!
No, there isn't. Now get out of here or you'll be killed too.
Charges are active. Campbell, lower the core damping field.
Goodbye, Jun'ko. Win this one for me!
Jun'ko, Mr Trent – get aboard, quickly.
Colonel Zane, I am hoping you can bring Jacobi back alive. You know how important she will be for the Order in the days ahead.

This is as far as the Osiris can take you. The jump-hole to the New York Badlands is in the debris field a short distance from here. You will meet Walker at Buffalo, inside the Badlands. Orillion out.
There you are. I've uploaded the coordinates to the jump-hole. Trent, take the lead. King and I will follow you. Let's go.
I'd started to fear the worst.
After he helped us escape from Manhattan, I'm sure the entire Liberty Navy was after him.
Great job, Trent! You take point. We're headed to Buffalo, a heavily fortified Rogue base. Walker should be waiting for us there.
Thank you. Trent, you dock first. Pick up some ammo and equipment – I have a feeling we'll need it to get through this one.
Walker, are you there? We're on our way.
Perfect. It's good to be flying with you again, Walker.
Moving to intercept. Trent, King, engage the hostiles!
Holy–! What kind of weapons are they carrying?
Nice job, everyone. Watch my back while I run Orillion's passcodes on the gate.
Got it! The gate's unlocked. Trent, King, go ahead. My people will follow you in.
Or dead. We don't have any choice. Maybe we just got lucky. Ready your sidearms. I'll dock first. Trent, you're next. Then King.
Here comes the hard part. We're not going to surprise them this time.
They blocked the jump-gate. We're trapped!
There's only one way out! We have to punch through them!
Walker, what are you talking about?
All right! Everybody, head for the jump-gate! We have to make a run for it.
I've sealed the jump-gate behind us.
A new specialised satellite that the Navy deployed recently. Our sources say it is designed to detect cloaked ships.
Like the Osiris. If we take out the satellite, Orillion and the Osiris could operate in this system without being detected.
We're coming up on the jump-hole. Trent, after you.
The satellite installation is very close. I'm uploading the coordinates to you now. Take the lead, Trent.
My scanner is picking up the satellite. I'm not detecting any ships... could be a trap.
Confirmed! Let's take this thing out quickly.
We've got Navy fighters on an intercept course. We have to stop these guys.
It's an ambush. Take these guys out!
Trent, good. We just received a message from Orillion with new orders. Everybody ready?
Understood, we'll see you at the rendezvous. Trent, take point.
There is a jump-hole nearby that will get us very close to our target.
Me, too. The only thing I know for sure is that the Navy has a jump-gate at the heart of Zone-21. It leads to Alaska. Everything else is rumour or speculation.
I can't believe Walker is still alive! It'll be good to see him again.
Me, too. I can't wait to hear his story.
You first, Trent. I wouldn't be surprised if the Navy is guarding all the jump-holes into New York by now.
Juni, are you seeing this? LSF ships!
All prototypes destroyed! More hostiles incoming!
Hurry, we're barely holding on here.
Walker, you know this is a dead-end system. We have to take the same way back out!
I don't like this. The docking ports are live, but there's no other activity. It's almost as if all the guards are asleep.
Nomad ships! We've got to get to the jump-gate!
They keep bringing in more ships!
We can't hold them off any longer!
Juni, he cleared a path for us. This is our chance! The jump-gate is clear!
More Nomads are closing, we have to get out of here!
Juni, I'm reading multiple weapons platforms directly next to the satellite.
Good work! Let's proceed to the rendezvous. We've lost enough time here.
That's it. The Nomads are about to kill Jacobi. We're out of time.
Liberty Rogues! Reminds me of simpler times...
Juni, what do you know about Alaska? It's not on any of the star charts. All I've ever heard were rumours.
I've always heard that the Navy is constructing a secret fleet there. I suppose we'll see with our own eyes soon.
Acknowledged. We're already at the rendezvous point.

Dynamic.Part: Thank you, Jun'ko. A lot has happened since you left Liberty. The democracy we once served is now a bloodthirsty military dictatorship.
My crew and I were forced to leave the central systems. We've been prowling the Independent Worlds, destroying Rheinland supply depots.
A strange life for a career Navy officer.

Subtitles.Static: There's no way we can handle this gate with these ships on our backs!
I don't have an easy answer, King. It doesn't matter until we get Jacobi.
Something's wrong. The prison station should be hailing us by now.
The jump-gate is near. Stay on course! We'll make it!
Jun'ko, we'll all die if we stay here! You've got to get the President to safety!
I have a large quantity of gravimetric mines onboard. Enough for both of these battleships! I just need to get close enough...
I know. It's what has to be done. The President is the only thing that matters now. Get her out of here!
Roger. Moving out! Don't fire on anything.
We should be at the prison shortly.
I have to rejoin my attack group on the far side of the Badlands. I'm sorry that I can't come with you now, but we'll meet you as planned at Zone-21.
We have incoming hostiles. All units, power up weapons!
Protect the jump-gate at all cost!
This is the Omaha. Give yourselves up. You are outnumbered and outgunned. Return the President and we will spare your life.
We have heavy casualties! We've lost contact to the engine room.
Fires are out of control. Life support is failing. All hands, abandon ship!
We have a breach! Everybody, evac–!
Colonel Zane, we've been expecting you. Captain Walker is waiting for you inside.
I don't know. We'll get back to this later, I promise!
Excuse me. You wanted to see me, Sir?
Understood. I take it then the President is unharmed?

Dynamic.Part: Madame President, these are the people you should be thanking.

Subtitles.Static: Set course for Toledo. Tell Quintaine we may have more information for him.

Dynamic.Part: Oh, and... tell him we've got an official guest for him to meet.

Subtitles.Static: The information your team brought back has shown a clear spread of the contamination. All of the colonies have now been affected.
If not the leaders, then key military units in the field. They're getting stronger.
Communication is breaking down. Soon this will develop into all-out genocide.
With the Nomads coming in to easily wipe out what's left. We need...

Dynamic.Part: That's right. They've been taking over Human beings from some time now, controlling them.

Subtitles.Static: One that no Human had ever set foot on. Unfortunately, when they penetrated its crust-
Sir, we have Jacobi. The Chancellor is dead – so are several of his Liberty hosts.
We have some weapons and raided their tactical files.
Come on, Colonel Trent! Have a drink with a fellow officer.
Do you remember, Trent, when I said people are changed by their world, rarely vice versa?
Well, I did. You know what? I was wrong!
Truly for some people, they can change the world. We're doing it, right now!
Thank you for showing me that.

Dynamic.Part: But still me, if that's what you mean.

Subtitles.Static: Judging how everyone is acting, I assume you are the go-to man around here?
Colonel. I never properly thanked you for what you did back there on the prison ship.
Mr Orillion was just filling me in on the Nomad's progress in the colonies.

Dynamic.Part: Sir, we've cleared the Badlands. Your orders?

Subtitles.Static: Attention! Colonel Trent, please report to Orillion on the Landing Deck at once.
It was a routine scouting mission through Zone-21. We round purses seven. And a blast came from the right, a blast came from the left and we had no idea what to do.
Huh. It's not the time, it's the sides that keep changing.
Sure. As long as I'm not shot at, knocked out, held at gunpoint, electrocuted,
skewered alive by giant alien shape-shifters, have to dive out windows or fight off spindly Nomad incubi...
I'm not sure about this one.
C'mon, you two. We have work to do!
Come on, Trent. It's just the kind of mission you love. What do you say?
It's something for Quintaine and Sinclair. They need something – big!
They say that in order to activate the artefact, they need a Nomad power cell.

Dynamic.Part: Orillion has located a Nomad power source nearby. Once we have it, we'll head straight for the Order base in Toledo.

Subtitles.Static: Trent, unless we do this, we're dead in the water, you understand? King and I can't do this without you.
Trent, we've still got a job to do. Are you with me?
So, here we are my friend, in the thick of it.
I remember when you were fresh off the boat in Liberty. Seems like ages ago, doesn't it?

Dynamic.Part: Oh, you've got to be-

Subtitles.Static: Here's our intel. Long-range scanners have picked up a Nomad power source at the centre of a giant structure. It's surrounded by a plasma cloud that prevents deeper scans.
Negative. The structure appears to be abandoned. Keep your eyes open. I'm uploading the coordinates.

Dynamic.Part: Listen. The jump hole we used to get here is destabilizing.
We have to take the Osiris through now. It will be stable enough for small ships, but not for a long. You have to get the power source quickly and get out of here.

Subtitles.Static: Understood! All right, people! Let's do it.
Are you detecting any Nomads in the area?
We're directly above the structure. No visuals yet.
Look at the size of that thing...
It's a trap! That thing is still alive! Damn Intel was wrong! Nomads! They're everywhere!
Wait! We've got to bring down that shield first! Trent, I'm uploading the coordinates to you. The generators are located on the perimeter. They have to go down before you can enter!
One down! Two more to go!
The shield went down! Trent, head for the port on the northern hemisphere of the structure. I'm sending coordinates!
Trent! Hurry up! We can't hold out forever!
Taking heavy damage! I don't know how long I can keep it together!
Juni! On your six! Bank hard right!
We're surrounded! The more we shoot down, the more they keep coming.
We're pulling up a chair for an age. Let's get out of here.
Damn it! I don't think we're getting out of this one.
Trent, you take point. King and I will take flanking positions.
The power cell seems to be inside a central chamber. Looks like the only way in is through the vents on the top of the structure.
King and I will draw their fire, Trent! Head for the core and get that power cell.
We're holding them back, Trent! Get into the lair!
They just keep coming! You've got to hurry, Trent!
Losing shield containment! Structural integrity degrading!
Reading shows that the interior is filled with radiation. You'll only be able to withstand that for a minute or two, you have to be quick!
Trent, we're running out of time! The jump-hole is starting to collapse and–
Trent! Thank goodness you're all right!
Trent, the jump-hole is closing fast! King and I are on our way out. Go!
Osiris! This is Juni! We got the power cell and are heading home! Do you copy?
Orillion, come in! Do you copy, Over. Damn it! Something's jamming our frequencies!
King! Trent! Inbound at 12 o'clock high!
That was close! Thank you, Herr Von Claussen.
Trent, we can't afford to waste any time! Land on the planet immediately!
For every spirit, there's a proper place in hell!
Here each one learns his judgement and is assigned a place in hell!
Long-range radar had picked up increased Nomad activity in this area. I thought you could use some help. We have to leave before they return. Head to Toledo.
We have reports that the Kusari fleet has been defeated near New Tokyo.
The Nomads are now freely roaming throughout the colonies. The have begun their attack on Bretonia – nothing can stop them now.
Professor Quintaine has everything prepared – land on Toledo.
Jun'ko. Your signal is breaking out.
Trent, the jump hole is closing fast. You have to hurry.
The Jump Hole is almost closed! Trent, get out of there!
Trent, you only have a few seconds left to get out.
Ten minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Nine minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Eight minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Seven minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Six minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Five minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Four minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Warning! Three minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Warning! Two minutes remaining to jump hole collapse.
Warning! One minute remaining to jump hole collapse.
Warning! Thirty seconds remaining to jump hole collapse.

Dynamic.Part: What is this place?
This, Mr Trent, is the secret home of the Order. Orillion and his people have built this out of nothing in only a few months.
The Nomad power cell is in the hold, guys.
Take it directly to Doctor Quintaine in the artefact lab.
That was a little too close.
Ah, next time listen to your old pal King and, uh, say no.
As you know, Doctor Quintaine and I have pored through the translations from the panels, the Proteus Tome, and even the stolen data from the prison ship.
It seems the Daam K'Vosh had a vast empire long before man ever evolved.
So if these guys were so much more advanced than us, where are they now?
We don't know, Mr Trent.
There's no evidence to suggest any kind of war or disease or natural disaster that may have done away with them. They just vanished, leaving behind the Nomads.
It seems Nomads, or whatever they were really called – we can't pronounce the name yet – they were apparently created by the Daam K'Vosh to, well, look after things.
We're fighting the caretakers?
Well, in a manner of speaking. They are opportunistic parasites, not only of Human beings, but of technology, as well.
Which brings us to the artefact. The Daam K'Vosh had an amazingly advanced technology that was only partially based in these delicate formations.
They used them for power, shields, erm... this one is, a, erm... well, we'll show you. Kendra?
I discovered that if the computer sounded out the phonetic representation of the glyphs in a particular order–
Please, Doctor, in deference to those for us who are simple politicians...
Very well.
I'll be damned.
It's beautiful!
What's that?
That would be us. The artefact knows where it is in space at all times.
It's a map!
But of what?
Well, it's just a theory, but–
Spit it out, Doctor!
From what we now know, with an empire as large as the Daam K'Vosh, they couldn't rely on simple jump-gates like we have today.
They had to develop something more sophisticated. A vast array of hyper-gates linking the far corners of their empire via one incredibly fast system for travel.
This device is not only the map, it's the trigger. A key to reawakening the system!
Are you suggesting we turn this thing on?
Yes. If we can reactivate the hyper-gates, we'll break the hold of the Nomads on their power supply and cut them down to a more manageable size. In theory.
Every key has a lock, Doctor. Where do we find this one?
There.
Mr Trent?
Me?
Yes, you. I want you and Zane to spearhead this effort. Understood?
All right. I've come this far, I may as well see it through.
What's going on?
Nomads, sir! A whole fleet of them!
Prepare ships for intercept!
Aye, sir!
Dammit, they must have followed us! We have to evacuate. Everybody to their ships! Take only what you need. Trent, Juni! We have to buy some time.
We're on it!
Now, how do we turn this tinker toy into a weapon?
Alpha and Gamma wings: cleared for launch.
The Nomads have destroyed the primary generator! All support personnel, move to evacuation points immediately!
Be careful out there!
You too!
I don't think I can do this.
Trent?!
No. Let him go.
The man's earned the right to a little time.
He'll be back.
Trent! I'm happy to see you've come back.
I take it you reconsidered?

Subtitles.Static: Looks like the base has taken a pounding.
It's unbelievable! The Nomads are constantly getting reinforcements. We won't be able to hold them off much longer.
The evacuation should be almost complete. We have to land quickly.
Quintaine, fly directly to the rallying point in the nebula. Trent and I will provide you cover.
This is it. Everybody to their ships! Trent, Juni, escort the freighter with Quintaine and Sinclair.
Our forces will meet in the nebula field on the far side of the system. Good luck.
Trent! We've made modifications to the artefact. It should work now.
All you need to do is activate it in the right location. What's the status out there?
Herr Von Claussen! You're coming with us?
The briefing's already started. Let's go!

Dynamic.Part: Is everyone clear on their assignments?
Okay, then.

Subtitles.Static: Ah, Trent, Jun'ko. Good, you've arrived. We're just now discussing our attack plan.
Long-range scans have detected a Nomad jump-gate in the area that will lead us to our final destination.
We'll fly there through the Badlands, which should give us some cover from the Nomad attacks.
We'll enter the jump-gate into what we think is the Nomad home world. Once there, we'll have to improvise.
We'll break into four attack groups. Trent, you will lead Alpha Team.

Dynamic.Part: I'll lead Beta and Colonel Zane will head up Gamma.

Subtitles.Static: A group of heavy bombers will maintain a holding pattern until we can clear them a path. Any questions?
The outcasts of society have now become the ones to save it.
In these precious moments, we've come together as one people.
In a way, we've already won the battle. Inside.
But that does not mean the war is over.

Dynamic.Part: We must still drive the Nomads from our worlds and avenge those we have lost.

Subtitles.Static: I'm going with you because I owe them something.

Dynamic.Part: I wouldn't miss it for the world.

Subtitles.Static: Look at that thing! I'm not picking up any ships.
Whatever it is, it's massive! Uploading coordinates.
Let's put an end to these Nomads, once and for all.
I'm reading a strong energy field around the structure. We have to find a way to disable it.
Be careful, Trent! Looks like they're surrounded by defense platforms.
Good shot, Trent! Damn it, no effect yet. Take out another one!
This is Colonel Zane. We are entering combat.
Trent, that's a personnel transport. We need to help them first. Let's go.
The Nomads will pay for this!
Acknowledged! I bet it's the base they're launching from. All units: concentrate your fire on the Nomad battleship.
Beta Wing: concentrate your fire on the engines. Alpha Wing, take out those turrets!
Alpha 5! A Nomad is on your tail. Get out of there!
One is directly behind you, Beta 4. Break!
Beta 5 is in trouble! Dammit! Beta 5 is down!
A Nomad has locked onto you, Gamma 4. Get out of there!
Dammit! The Nomads have destroyed Gamma 5!
We're doing well! Let's keep it up.
The Nomad ship is taking a beating. Keep concentrating your fire on it.
We almost got it. All wings, let's finish this thing off!
We did it! All wings - take out the remaining fighters!
Damn it! Another Nomad capital ship just uncloaked. All units: break off your attacks and engage the capital ship!
Sir, another Nomad capital ship just uncloaked! We can't leave–
Understood! Returning to base! Come on, Trent. Don't engage any Nomad fighters. We have to get back to Orillion.
You go first, Trent. I'll meet you on the surface.
Damn it! Trent, we have to protect the transport at all costs. Quintaine, keep heading towards the Osiris.
We made it! The Nomads are falling back.
Okay, this is it. Go ahead and land Trent. I'll meet up with you on the deck.
All right people, here we go.
I see the gate – there it is!
I've found an entrance through the barrier, but it looks heavily shielded. Looks like several power generators are supplying the shield with enough power that I can't penetrate it.
The first generator is gone. Good job, Alpha!
You did it, Trent! The shield is going down!
Trent, fly through the opening in the barrier. We'll follow you.
It looks like the Nomads built a complete shell around this sun!
All right, it's up to us.
It's a city! A giant Nomad city!
Trent, there are several generators powering that shield, much like the ones we destroyed earlier. Try taking them out – we'll cover you.
You did it! The shield is coming down!

Dynamic.Part: This is Orillion. The base is taking heavy damage from the Nomad attack group – several dozen small Nomad ships.
We don't know where they're coming from. You have to hold them off as long as you can. Orillion out!

Subtitles.Static: Colonel Trent! Colonel Zane! Break away from the battle and return to base immediately.
That's an order. Our tinker toy weapon is ready.

Dynamic.Part: We're picking up another set of signals. Yet another Nomad capital ship is approaching Omicron.
All combat wings: concentrate your fire on that ship and whatever else they throw at us. It is imperative that we buy our people some time to evacuate! I'm heading to the Osiris.
Colonel Zane, make sure that Quintaine and Sinclair get safely to the rallying point.

Subtitles.Static: To all units: I've arrived on the Osiris and we have reached the rallying point. Everybody – fall back!
Now that we're all here, let's move out. The coordinates to the Nomad jump-gate have been uploaded into everyone's Neural Nets.
The Osiris is too large for the Nomad gate and won't be able to assist us.
According to our scans, the Nomad gate is close – just outside the nebula. Expect heavy resistance once we clear it.

Dynamic.Part: The Osiris will create a diversion on the other side of the system. Hopefully, the Nomads will fall for it.
Our strategy is to head directly into the Nomad gate. We believe the alien home world lies directly on the other side. Out best chance is a frontal assault with everything we have.

Subtitles.Static: Keep your eyes open! The Nomads are bound to know we're coming.
Trent, take point through the gate. Everybody else, follow.
Looks like a giant barrier of some sort. We must find a way to break through it.
I'm reading several strong energy signatures on the surface. Those could be our targets. All ships, head for the barrier.
We have to make sure that Trent can activate the artifact once we're on the other side. Alpha Wing, take flanking positions!
Understood! Trent, you and your wing have to take out the power generators. All other units continue to engage the Nomad fighters.
All units: proceed through the opening. Trent, you and your wing go first.
Incredible! It's similar to the old theory of a Dyson sphere. It allows the Nomads to harvest all energy coming from that sun.
All units: proceed to King's coordinates. Trent, this could be your target.
Trent, Juni, take your wings and proceed to the structure ahead. King, go with them. All other units: stay here and engage the Nomads.
Trent's wing has destroyed the third generator. Only one more...
This is Alpha Leader, Colonel Zane. Beta and Delta have been holding ground but we're taking steady losses.
This is Alpha, engaging the enemy.
Beta Leader here! We're going in.
Colonel Zane. This is Beta Leader. A large Nomad ship just uncloaked in our sector!
I can't make out a command centre. What is our primary target?
This is Delta Leader. Colonel Zane, we're here to escort you to the Osiris.
We took heavy losses during the evacuation. Only four transports and about two dozen fighters made it back to the Osiris.
Colonel Zane, we're approaching the Osiris.
Understood. We have to get out of here.
This is Transport 14. We're under attack! Our escort is down! We need assistance!

Dynamic.Part: No, I'm already committed. We've only got one shot at this!

Subtitles.Static: She's right... This was only round one... they know we're here now... they'll be back.
Home? And where is that now?
Home? In Manhattan...? You know, it doesn't sound so bad now... Now if I could just get a good Sidewinder Fang. Let's go.
What? But we just... I mean they're...
Trent, it's the artefact! Something's gone wrong!

Dynamic.Part: It's too dangerous! Trent, jettison that thing before it blows!
Trent!
No. They're gone but they're not beaten...

Subtitles.Static: Manhattan, Trent. You can do a lot of good there.
You're a Freelancer, Trent. You can go anywhere, and do anything. Besides, I'm sure we can work something out.
Trent! I'm picking up an energy surge from your ship! Seven hundred rels and rising!

Dynamic.Part: Nine hundred rels!
Twenty five hundred rels!
The hyper-gate is open!
...and it's driving out the Nomads. They can't take the redistribution of power.
The Order will watch this gate.
We'll be ready for them next time.
There is much to be done in the colonies to repair what has happened. You're needed at home, Trent.
It's beautiful.

Subtitles.Static: Perhaps with the Gate open we can take the war to them - wherever, indeed, they are...

Dynamic.Part: It's been nearly two weeks since the hostilities between Rheinland and the other houses came to an abrupt end, and peace has settled over the colonies.
Despite many lingering questions, government officials remain tight-lipped about what has triggered this sudden change.
In other news, LSF commander Jun'ko Zane and Freelancer Edison Trent – both former enemies of the state – have been granted full pardons and have received the Lone Star for Bravery,
the highest decoration an individual in the colonies can receive, though the details of their heroism have been sealed by executive order.
Meanwhile, the Chancellor and several of his staff are still missing at this time, and face a long list of charges.
Newly-appointed government officials in Rheinland are now looking into recent events and are even said to have enlisted Liberty to aid in their investigation.

Subtitles.Static: I guess you can't rush the President – or Amnesty.
Orillion! Let me tell Juni you're here.
Ah, call me Trent. Pleased to meet you.
Please Senator, just call me Trent.
Well, I think it's safe to say that I'm just getting started.
No, Colonel Trent. Even with the colonies rebuilding
and the contaminated Human population restored to normal, the threat isn't over.
For now, it's better I stay less well-known. I just wanted to see if you would consider a proposition.
To be the eyes and the ears of the Order here in Liberty. Think about it.
I never told you – I asked the bartender about you the day we met...
Sorry, I'm late. The debriefing took longer than usual.
Not to mention the generous reward!
Hang on, one second, I'll be right back.
Trent, let me introduce Mr Harrison, our newest diplomat. Mr Harrison, Edison Trent.
The pleasure is mine, Mr Trent. President Jacobi speaks highly of you.
Could be useful later. Thank you.
You strike me as being able to offer more.
I'm beting that you have more for me.
I thought I take another look around.
Yeah. Sorry about that. Can you give me something now?
If you have what I want I'm ready to deal.
So your stock here. Thought I check it out.
I'm just seeing what I can find around here.
I'm just checking out your wares.
Thought I'd see what you had over here.
What else? Sounds okay so far.
If you give me something I wouldn't let you down this time. Trust me.
